1923 PLANS REUNION
The 1923 Class Reunion Committee, headed by "Tom" Landy,
held a meeting last night after the
0. D. K. meeting in 206, M. E.
Building. The committee is considering holding the reunion after
the St. John's or Maryland State
game, probably to be followed by a

UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA TO ESTABLISH A
BUREAU OF VOCATION- ,
AL INFORMATION
The Hopkins English Department has received a request for information from the University of
North Carolina regarding the vocational assistance that is accorded
Hopkins students. The request is
the result of the decision of that
university to found an efficient Bureau of Vocational Information.
This bureau is expected to place
at the student's disposal a considerable quantity of vocational
formation, including books and various statistics. It is also designed
to 'aid the student in choosing a
course which will prepare him best
for his lifework. This department
will be an extension of the idea
that the courses of the pre-medical
students at Hopkins shall be decided upon by the faculty.
The Hopkins vocational service
is practically limited to the requirements of English Composition
which every freshman must take.

1923 PLANS REUNION
The 1923 Class Reunion Committee, headed by "Tom" Landy,
held a meeting last night after the
0. D. K. meeting in 206, M. E.
Building. The committee is considering holding the reunion after
the St. John's or Maryland State
game, probably to be followed by a

UNIVERSITY OF NORTH CAROLINA TO ESTABLISH A
BUREAU OF VOCATION- ,
AL INFORMATION
The Hopkins English Department has received a request for information from the University of
North Carolina regarding the vocational assistance that is accorded
Hopkins students. The request is
the result of the decision of that
university to found an efficient Bureau of Vocational Information.
This bureau is expected to place
at the student's disposal a considerable quantity of vocational
formation, including books and various statistics. It is also designed
to 'aid the student in choosing a
course which will prepare him best
for his lifework. This department
will be an extension of the idea
that the courses of the pre-medical
students at Hopkins shall be decided upon by the faculty.
The Hopkins vocational service
is practically limited to the requirements of English Composition
which every freshman must take.
